What should a crisis management plan include?

A crisis management plan should include the doctrine, structure, processes, roles, and responsibilities that comprise the Crisis Management Program. It should outline strategies to respond effectively to crises, activate response systems, ensure employee safety, and sustain critical operations. The plan should also facilitate internal and external communications, track and report progress of evacuation and operational continuity efforts, and identify and resolve unmet needs or obstacles.
